meta.article_title: April 10, 2023 - Top Ten Things For the Day Before the Tournament

terminologie_extrait.contexte: a drill to get your feet going

debutant.description: Do at least one footwork drill to get your feet going. Practice your serves before a tournament. Make sure you can keep your serves low, accurate, with lots of spin and/or deception.

Regardless of how much you practice just before a tournament, the point is to tune up your shots, not to change your technique or learn new ones. If you want to do that, then you probably shouldn't be playing in tournaments until you've changed or learned those techniques.
You don't need to practice them all, just the ones you want to work! (Yes, that includes pushing.)
Always practice your serves before a tournament. Make sure you can keep your serves low, accurate, with lots of spin and/or deception.
If there's a specific serve that gives you trouble that you think you might face in the tournament, now's a good time to ask someone to serve it to you.

Along with practicing your serves and tuning up your strokes, this is the most important thing to prepare for a tournament. You don't want to play your first tournament match where you haven't played any for a time.

exercices_complementaires.description: If possible, arrange a practice partner for both the day before (for warming up before playing practice matches) and at the tournament before your first matches.
